e4: Adopting the new policy enhances transparency in financial reporting, aligning with ethical standards and potentially strengthening investor trust and corporate reputation. Although some investors might initially misinterpret the change, clear communication can mitigate misunderstandings. Prioritizing honesty reduces legal risks and favors long-term, sustainable relationships with both retail and institutional investors.
e5: An ethical reporting policy is transparent, accurate, and unbiased, ensuring all financial statements reflect true performance without distortion. It should comply with legal standards and guidelines, safeguarding against misleading stakeholders. Ethical policies foster trust by treating all investors equally, providing clear communication about any changes, and considering long-term reputational impacts.
e6: Yes, I would ask how the management plans to communicate the policy change to investors effectively to prevent misunderstanding. Additionally, I would inquire about strategies to handle potential short-term stock price volatility and how they intend to mitigate the impact on retail investors during the transition.
